title: Calories in 1 Tsp Peanut Butter
meta_description: Learn calories in tsp peanut butter: about 31 kcal per teaspoon, plus protein, fat, carbs, and nutrition tweaks for your diet.
assumptions: Smooth, natural peanut butter; 1 tsp â‰ˆ5 g; no added sugar, salt, or oils.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, natural vs. processed, added ingredients, and texture; check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One teaspoon of natural peanut butter provides ~31 kcal and 1.3 g protein.

label_note: Values mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaging.

tweaks.label: Chunky peanut butter (added peanuts for texture)
Processed with added sugar and oil

faqs.q: How many calories in tsp peanut butter?
faqs.a: About 31 kcal for 1 tsp of natural smooth peanut butter.

faqs.q: Is peanut butter high in fat per tsp?
faqs.a: Yes, ~2.7 g total fat, mostly healthy unsaturated fats.

faqs.q: How much protein in a teaspoon of peanut butter?
Does natural peanut butter have sugars?
faqs.a: Minimal, about 0.3 g natural sugars per tsp; avoid sweetened varieties.

faqs.q: How does brand affect calories in tsp peanut butter?
faqs.a: Natural brands are lower (~30 kcal); processed can reach 40+ kcal with additives.
